Description: The National Transit Database provides information on public transportation systems in the U.S., including ridership statistics and funding information.
511 is a toll-free phone service providing real-time traffic and travel information, including road conditions and transit options across the U.S.

Amtrak provides intercity train service across the U.S., offering schedules, fares, and travel information for passengers.
Greyhound offers intercity bus travel across the U.S., with schedules, fares, and booking options available online.
Lyft is a ridesharing service available in many U.S. cities, providing on-demand transportation via a mobile app.
Uber offers ridesharing services in numerous locations across the U.S., allowing users to request rides through its mobile app.
Many U.S. cities offer paratransit services for individuals with disabilities, providing accessible transportation options.
The FTA provides financial and technical assistance to local transit systems, promoting safe and accessible transit services.
A comprehensive list of various ridesharing services available across the U.S., helping individuals find transportation options.
APTA advocates for public transit and provides resources, research, and information on public transportation across the U.S.

Community Transit provides public transportation services in various counties, focusing on local routes and services.
NHTSA promotes safe driving practices and provides information on vehicle safety and transportation regulations.
combined: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) https://www.nhtsa.gov/

Description: Uber for Business offers rideshare solutions tailored for companies, providing transportation options for employees.
This organization advocates for walking, biking, and public transit in New York City and beyond, providing resources for sustainable transportation.
Ride Connection offers transportation services for seniors and individuals with disabilities in the Portland, Oregon area.
This organization promotes smart growth and sustainable transportation initiatives across the U.S., providing resources and advocacy.
NJTPA coordinates transportation planning efforts in northern New Jersey, providing resources and information for residents.

Description: NADA Drive is a resource for finding transportation assistance and information for individuals seeking help with driving and car ownership.

GoTransit provides information on public transportation options and services in various regions across the U.S.
Citymapper is a mobile app that provides real-time public transit information, including route planning and live updates for various cities.
An advocacy organization focused on improving transportation policies and infrastructure to enhance mobility across the U.S.
Local agencies provide specific transportation solutions and resources tailored to their respective communities across the U.S.
RideShare NJ provides information and resources for carpooling and vanpooling options in New Jersey.
Various programs across the U.S. provide transportation services specifically designed for seniors, addressing their mobility needs.
NJ Transit Rail offers train services across New Jersey and into New York City, providing schedules and fare information.
Many cities in the U.S. offer bike share programs that provide access to bicycles for short-term rentals for local transportation.
Services that help individuals find carpool partners in their area, promoting shared transportation and reducing commuting costs.
